data.title: A JavaScript error occurred in the main process
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2 (zip version)
- OS Version: Windows 7 Enterprise SP1 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download zip installer from: https://code.visualstudio.com/
2. Unzip
3. Double-click Code.exe
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1699382/26727209/e7181132-4773-11e7-8e2e-f9063aea5704.png)

As per https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11378 and https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/10616 I have neither `APPDATA` nor `USERPROFILE` environment variables. Yes I have `%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Roaming`.

data.title: Npm task autodetect should contribute install & update even if no script section is present
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Windows

I got npm install showng up after I added a script section. IMO install and update should show up if the package.json has a dependencies or devDependencies section.

data.title: Automated smoke tests depends on installed NodeJS

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- I ran the automated smoke test as described in #27456
- They failed with
```
Running tests...
npm ERR! Test failed.  See above for more details.
```
Running the tests with sudo showed the real problem:
```
/home/aeschli/workspaces/vscode/test/smoke/src/main.js:15
var testRepoLocalDir = path.join(process.cwd(), `${tempFolder}/vscode-smoketes
                                                ^
SyntaxError: Unexpected token ILLEGAL
```
Changing the version of the installed NodeJS to 7.5 fixed the issue

This could be fixed by avoiding ES6 syntax, or by adding a version check or by using electron run the tests.

data.title: Automated smoke test should disable all external extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- run the automated smoke test as described in #27456
- I see from the opened windows that it contains external extension that I happened to have installed.

It would better if the smoke test, by default, turns off all extensions (run with `--disable-extensions`) in order to keep the test runs reliable and repeatable.

data.title: VS Code constantly freezing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1 Try to perform any actions at all using the editor; pasting, typing, anything.
2. Fans kick-in on computer (MSI GE62), everything freezes. VS Code asks do I want to close the window or wait. 

This problem only started happening today and is stopping me from using the editor completely. I only have around 6 extensions. Sublime and all other programs are working as normal.

Thanks.

data.title: Random switch to 4 spaces per tab
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b)
- OS Version: Windows 8

## Steps to Reproduce:

Use VSCode for a prolonged period of time with TypeScript sources.

## Result:

VSCode switches from 2 spaces per tab to 4 spaces per tab, and resets only when the whole editor is restarted.

data.title: Ctrl-drag'n'drop doesn't work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b)
- OS Version: Windows 8

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select some text
2. Hold Ctrl
3. Drag text and drop it somewhere

## Result:

Nothing. If doing it over URL, it gets opened.

## Expected

Should copy selected fragment of text.

data.title: Welcome: links to install extension could read a little more (aria)
data.body: Currently all I hear from a screen reader is the text of the link, but I suggest to add an aria label that tells that the link is for installing the extension.

data.title: Alt-selection doesnt work

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b)
- OS Version: Windows 8

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. Press Alt
2. Select text

## Result:

Normal selection 

## Expected

Similar to Alt+Shift selection in VSCode, but should work as a normal selection: use mousedown position as first corner of rectangle and current position as second corner.

data.title: Terminal doesn't launch under 64 bit
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Windows 64 / Code 64

I have setup my terminal path like this: `"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\WINDOWS\\Sysnative\\cmd.exe"`

Trying to open the terminal results in the blank terminal with a cursor.

data.title: "Screen reader detected": guide the user how to get out of this mode
data.body: Just an idea, but maybe we could allow to click on the status bar entry and then open settings with a hint about the new setting to disable automated detection of screen reader?

data.title: Menubar font is too tiny and unreadable
data.body:
The menu bar font is very tiny and unreadable with normal zoom level, I did some googling and I couldn't find a way to edit it.

I'm using the NVIDIA driver-374 and this display is from an HDMI screen (I'm not sure if that info helps)
I'm still a newbie so please excuse me if some info is missing/irrelevant

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version:
```
Distributor ID:	LinuxMint
Description:	Linux Mint 18.1 Serena
Release:	18.1
Codename:	serena
```
Steps to Reproduce: (not sure)

1. Install i3wm
2. Install vscode
3. Use an HDMI external screen
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10996982/26725138/5a35b290-479d-11e7-8a8d-fa34b5e08806.png)

Pasting text from the web sometimes brings unneeded special characters as well

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Creator Update

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy the comment on the first answer from here as an example https://magento.stackexchange.com/questions/130391/magento-2-how-to-get-current-currency-and-symbol-in-phtml-file/130395
2. Paste the text in VS code, you will find the text pasted normally, `Class Magento\\Directory\\Model\\CurrencyFact​ory`
2. However The actual pasted text is `Class Magento\\Directory\\Model\\CurrencyFact\u200c​ory does not exist` but the \u200 part is not visible when editing.

data.title: Don't parse snippets eagerly
data.body: Today user and extension snippets are parsed eagerly. We should postpone that until they are actually used, e.g when the language activates.

data.title: Explore binding between DOM elements in VS Code to the smoke test DOM element selectors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently it is difficult to know if any of the DOM elements touched during a development work are used in the smoke test. 

Continuation of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25291#issuecomment-302704524. 

**One example:** 
This following change lead to the smoke test failure because DOM element attribute was changed:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/eac49a321b84cb9828430e9dcd3f34243a3480f7
This attribute was used in the smoke test to grab the contents of SCM part in status bar:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/0aec2d6838b5e65cc74c33b853ffbd9fa191d636

data.title: Have ctrl+click work the same way as in Visual Studio

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
we use  dblclick LBtn to select a word, but using ctrl +LBtn  is a good way,
in vs studio we could do the following:
1. basic:  press  ctrl and click a word,  the word is selected.
2. advanced: when a word is selected ,  press ctrl+shift and select another word,   so we could select from the start of the  first word to the end of the last word
3.advanced: with ctrl down, we clicked a word, don't release the LBtn, move the mouse to  some where in the middle of the next word ,  the whole next word will be  selected.  this is the same effect as the  "ctrl + right"

data.title: advise on using drag&drop feature
data.body:
hi, 
shall I give some advice on this drag&drop feature?   as below:
add an option to enable  drag&drop  with  ctrl button:
users can drag only when ctrl is down, 
 if ctrl is up before drop ,   the operation is  cancled.

this is useful  if you don't really want to drag&drop but only selecting some text

data.title: Exception peek widget only shows for top stack frame
data.body:
Related #25104

Currently we only show the exception peek widget if an exception happened for the top stack frame.
This is wrong as an exception can happen in any of the stack frames.

All the code [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugEditorContribution.ts#L365) should instead just take the focused stack frame. Is there a special reason why you take the whole call stack and take the first one?

This is nothing urgent as it is not a regression and I propose to fix it in June debt week.

data.title: Git: cannot undo a change in this folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. have a folder `super cool stuff" ---?!?!() sdäü*`
2. add a file
3. from git viewlet undo

=> nothing happens

Output:
```
git clean -f -q -- /Users/bpasero/Development/monaco/super cool stuff" ---?!?!() sdäü*/tsfmt.json
git status -z -u
git symbolic-ref --short HEAD
git rev-parse master
git rev-parse --symbolic-full-name --abbrev-ref master@{u}
git rev-list --left-right master...origin/master
git for-each-ref --format %(refname) %(objectname)
git remote --verbose
```

data.title: Tree: set aria-setsize and aria-posinset

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The tree/list is virtualized and as such a screen reader cannot make a correct statement on the number of entries. We should leverage [aria-setsize](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/states_and_properties#aria-setsize) and [aria-posinset](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/states_and_properties#aria-posinset) for that purpose within the tree and list widgets. The widgets know the number of elements to render and the currently selected items position in the set.

/cc @joaomoreno @isidorn

data.title: Proposal: setting flag to disable js native interfaces
data.body:
Native interfaces like such:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12987425/26715603/68ab03c2-4787-11e7-8ce8-9ce3b0cb129b.png)

always get in the way when I want to use snippets. There should be an option to turn them off or filter them.

data.title: Nested snippets without final placeholder jumps to next outer placeholder
data.body:
* in ts/js
* insert a snippet with placeholders
* trigger completion to fill-in a placeholder
* :bug: the completion is inserted but immediately the next tabstop is selected

![jun-02-2017 09-20-35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/26715133/c3c47ecc-4774-11e7-90c4-cf388a7e96af.gif)

data.title: Extension details page does not generate correct "id" for non-English headers

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.12.2 - OS Version: Windows 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open the detail page of some extension with non-English texts 2. Open devtools for embedded webview 3. "id" attributes of headers ('' tag) with non-English text are not correctly assigned. **This makes internal links (`[link](#anchor)`) nonfunctional.** See example using my extension with Japanese text: When using Markdown preview, this issue **does not** occur: I guess this behavior comes from the difference between markdown render engine (#26841)?
